1.text: Tie the bow in the center of your body or off to the side.

2.text: Hold the fabric belt so one end is 6 inches (15 cm) longer than the other.

3.text: Cross the short end over the long end.

4.text: Pull the long end up through the opening to tie a basic knot.

5.text: Create a loop with the long end as if you were about to tie a bow.

6.text: Wrap the short end of the belt around the bow and through the loop you created.

7.text: Tug the bow to make it bigger or smaller and tighten the knot.

8.text: Decide if you want your bow to be in the center or off to the side.

9.text: Position the fabric belt so that the two ends are at equal lengths.

10.text: Cross one end over the other and create a knot.

11.text: Create a loop with each end of the belt.

12.text: Wrap one loop around the other and tuck it up under the belt.

13.text: Adjust the size of the bow and tighten the knot once you’re done.

14.text: Pair the pants with a more form-fitting top.

15.text: Tuck in your top so the bow doesn’t get lost under your shirt.

16.text: Add a statement necklace or pair of earrings to your outfit.

17.text: Wear a pair of heels or fancy flats to finish your outfit.
